subject: Data
title: The Future: Databases That Run Themselves
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Future: Databases That Run Themselves.

hook.text: Oracle's Autonomous Database claims to tune, patch, and heal itself without any human DBA intervention.

buildup.text: Self-driving databases use machine learning to automatically optimize queries, allocate resources, and fix issues.

discovery.text: AI can analyze query patterns and create indexes, adjust memory allocation, and predict failures before they happen.

twist.text: Full autonomy remains aspirational. Complex migrations, schema changes, and business logic still need human judgment.

climax.text: The trend is clear: databases are becoming more autonomous, turning DBAs from operators into strategic advisors.

punchline.text: Databases are learning to manage themselves.

quiz.question: What do autonomous databases use to self-optimize?
options: Machine learning to analyze patterns and predict issues
